thread.title: Umpqua Community College shooting, gun politics and the NRA: Letters to the Editor
thread.title_full: Umpqua Community College shooting, gun politics and the NRA: Letters to the Editor | OregonLive.com

author: Letters to the editor
title: Umpqua Community College shooting, gun politics and the NRA: Letters to the Editor
text:
Guns politics and the NRA: I have some questions for the National Rifle Association and their extreme followers:
In light of Thursday's carnage at Umpqua Community College in southern Oregon, does every educational facility in America — grade schools, middle schools, high schools, community colleges, universities — have to get shot up and produce a body count before new, effective restrictions are enacted to keep nut-jobs away from your sacred guns?
How many innocent lives will it take?
Give us a number, if you can.
Marvin Thiessen
Northeast Portland
•
Guns politics and the NRA:
My personal statement of moral conviction:
Today I honor those who lost their lives in Roseburg, Oregon, those injured and all those who love them by stating clearly and absolutely that I will never again vote for any candidate of any political party who is a member of the National Rifle Association or has accepted campaign contributions from the National Rifle Association.
I will never again vote for any candidate of any political party who opposes reasonable and sensible gun control legislation, which is supported by a majority of the electorate.
This carnage must be stopped if we are to continue to call ourselves a civilized society.
Robert E. Enninga
